def.dt: :a shallow container that you cook or serve food in a baking/serving dish [=a container used to bake/serve food] a casserole/pie dish [=a container used to bake a casserole/pie]
:a shallow bowl a candy dish [=a container used to serve candy] the cat's food/water dish
:the food served in a dish a dish of strawberries a small dish of ice cream

:food that is prepared in a particular way Each person made a dish for the potluck supper. The restaurant serves some of my favorite dishes. a fish/pasta/potato dish [=food that has fish/pasta/potatoes as a main ingredient] The main dish [=the biggest dish of a meal] was poached salmon, and it was served with a side dish [=a food that is served at the same time as the main dish] of spinach.

:all the things (such as plates, forks, glasses, pans, cooking utensils, etc.) that are used to prepare, serve, and eat a meal We piled all the dishes in the sink after dinner. Will you wash the breakfast dishes, please? a sink full of dirty dishes It's your turn to do the dishes. [=wash the dishes]
:a shallow container that holds something other than food a soap dish

:something that is shaped like a shallow bowl Do you have cable TV or a dish? [=an antenna shaped like a dish that receives television signals from a satellite] a dish antenna see also petri dish satellite dish
:a sexually attractive person I hear your cousin is a dish. [=hottie]
:to talk about the personal life of someone else :gossip The two of them are always dishing about their coworkers.
:to serve (food) The restaurant dishes out more than 500 meals every night.
:to give (something) freely or in large amounts She dishes out advice to anyone who'll listen. He's always dishing out money and gifts to his grandchildren.
:to criticize other people He can dish it out, but he can't take it. [=he likes to criticize other people, but he doesn't like being criticized]
:to put (food) into a dish or dishes for serving or eating dish up some soup sometimes used figuratively The movie dishes up [=serves up] a wild mix of sex and violence.
:liquid soap that is used for washing dishes called also (US) dishwashing detergent (US) dishwashing liquid (Brit) washing-up liquid
:a rack that you place dishes on so they can dry see picture at kitchen
:a cloth that is used for drying dishes called also (Brit) tea cloth (chiefly Brit) tea towel see picture at kitchen
:a dish that is used for cooking or warming food at the table
:baked in a dish that has high sides deep-dish pizza a deep-dish apple pie
:a small, shallow dish that has a loose cover and that is is used in scientific experiments especially for growing bacteria
:a device that is shaped like a large dish and that receives television signals from a satellite high above the earth
